DOC.brief_summary: The aim study evaluate whether use prochlorperazine ketorolac combination lead large reduction pain score compare prochlorperazine alone treat pediatric migraine Emergency Department ( ED ) . Our hypothesis combination medication treat pain also associate gastrointestinal symptom migraine . The main outcome study reduction patient 's pain score 60 minute administration study medication . Secondary outcome include number patient achieve complete resolution headache ED , number patient require additional treatment intervention treat physician , number patient resolution associate symptom like nausea , vomit , photophobia phonophobia , recurrence headache 48-72 hour discharge , side effect medication .
DOC.brief_title: Prochlorperazine Versus Prochlorperazine & Ketorolac Treatment Pediatric Migraine Emergency Department
DOC.criteria: 1. patient age 818 year present Akron Children 's Hospital ( ACH ) ED complaint headache 2. patient establish diagnosis migraine without aura establish history meet criteria migraine headache define International Criteria Headache Disorder II 2004 . At least 5 episode headache b . The headache last 172 hour c. The headache include two follow : . Unilateral location , though may bifrontal frontotemporal location occipital ii . Pulsing quality iii . Moderate severe pain iv . Aggravation cause avoidance routine physical activity d. One follow symptom accompany headache i. Nausea vomit ii . Photophobia phonophobia e. The headache attribute another disorder base history , physical and/or laboratory information . 1 . Patients contraindication receive prochlorperazine , ketorolac , diphenhydramine , naproxen 2 . Patients unable complete pain scale . 3 . Patients medication drugdrug interaction study medication include prochlorperazine , ketorolac , diphenhydramine naproxen . 4 . Patients medical condition may contribute associated current headache concussion trauma 5 . Female patient positive urine HCG point care test 6 . Patients diagnosis suspect chronic daily headache define headache last least 4 hour 15 day month past 3 month . 7 . Patients receive prochlorperazine ketorolac past 48 hour . 8 . Patients previously randomize study past 3 month .
